thread.title: See Josh Donaldson blast another postseason home run
thread.title_full: See Josh Donaldson blast another postseason home run | AL.com

author: Mark Inabinett | minabinett@al.com
title: See Josh Donaldson blast another postseason home run
text:
Toronto third baseman Josh Donaldson hit a long home run on Monday night as the Blue Jays battled to get back in the American League Championship Series against the Kansas City Royals. Toronto entered Game 3 of the best-of-seven series in a 2-0 hole to the defending American League champion.
Josh Donaldson with the 2nd-longest HR this postseason (Kyle Schwarber, 461 is longest) pic.twitter.com/PT4MR4EmiR
— ESPN Stats & Info (@ESPNStatsInfo) October 20, 2015 Donaldson was a baseball and football star at Faith Academy in Mobile before playing baseball for Auburn .
Donaldson rapped a run-scoring single in the second before hammering a two-run home run in the third that gave Toronto a 9-2 lead at the Rogers Centre in Toronto.
Donaldson's home run was the second of the inning for the Blue Jays. Shortstop Troy Tulowitzki hit a three-run homer earlier in the Toronto's six-run third.
Your browser does not support iframes. Donaldson hit 41 home runs during the regular season, when he led the American League in runs and RBIs. He hit two home runs during the AL Division Series against the Texas Rangers, connecting in Game 2 on Oct. 9 after leaving Game 1 with an injury and smacking another in Game 4 on Oct. 12 off former Wallace State pitcher Derek Holland .
Most HR in Single Postseason - Blue Jays History 2015 Josh Donaldson 3 1993 Paul Molitor 3 1992 Joe Carter 3 1992 Candy Maldonado 3
— ESPN Stats & Info (@ESPNStatsInfo) October 20, 2015
